item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. You might not need WebSockets (167 points | 124 comments)
2. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (122 points | 105 comments)
3. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (324 points | 155 comments)
4. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (157 points | 32 comments)
5. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (125 points | 8 comments)
6. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (221 points | 123 comments)
7. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (83 points | 12 comments)
8. Show HN: Omiword – A daily, sector-based word puzzle (24 points | 20 comments)
9. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (243 points | 353 comments)
10. AI Coding and the Peanut Butter and Jelly Problem (54 points | 33 comments)
11. Datastar: Web Framework for the Future? (184 points | 98 comments)
12. Germany creates 'super–high-tech ministry' for research, technology, aerospace (156 points | 161 comments)
13. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (112 points | 72 comments)
14. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (137 points | 99 comments)
15. Bilinear interpolation on a quadrilateral using Barycentric coordinates (112 points | 28 comments)
16. Leaked data reveals Israeli govt campaign to remove pro-Palestine posts on Meta (748 points | 429 comments)
17. But what if I want a faster horse? (1235 points | 534 comments)
18. A recent study suggests that insects branched out from crustaceans (77 points | 79 comments)
19. Lead is still bad for your brain (141 points | 126 comments)
20. That groan you hear is users' reaction to Recall going back into Windows (52 points | 40 comments)
21. Pinball Brothers – A Swedish-Italian Pinball Company (11 points | 2 comments)
22. In Guatemala, painted altar found at Tikal adds new context to Maya history (4 points | 1 comment)
23. Procedural Generation of Mammals and Locomotion (7 points | discuss)
24. Key principles on in-game virtual currencies in the EU (43 points | 25 comments)
25. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (114 points | 174 comments)
26. Strengths Are Your Weaknesses (295 points | 96 comments)
27. Modern 6502 (84 points | 7 comments)
28. Mosaic (YC W25) is building a general purpose agent for video editing ( | hide)
29. WebRTC for the Curious (109 points | 27 comments)
30. Rust CUDA Project (124 points | 38 comments)
